author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> regarding p2p incentivization, for L1 consensus data (LightClientUpdate and so on) the current spec puts the effort of gossipping that data onto the active sync committee, which is sort of incentivized by sync committee rewards. note there is no actual check that one also broadcasts the data, but there are rewards for thematically related validator duties (the sync committee messages and sync aggregates). for historical data, the protocol is designed in a way that it doesnt produce significant load and is serveable with just a couple memcpy from a database containing cached data.

it gets tricky for execution side, because light client may be interested in different aspects of the data. there are some efforts to move it into portal network, and there is also geth LES protocol. besides that, there are attempts to push centrally hosted infrastructure that serves json-rpc to include correctness proofs for any served data. which could then as a followup help with privacy because you no longer have to trust exit nodes of anonymization services to not tamper with the json-rpc response data. for state, there’s eth_getProof, for tx/receipt/withdrawal there is EIP-6493, EIP-6466 and EIP-6465. those lay the ground for allowing clients to be built in a forward compatible way so that proofs continue to work even as unrelated aspects of ethereum evolve. what’s still missing is transaction simulation, which is not perfectly solvable as it may depend on other transactions that execute before the simulated tx actually gets executed.

besides that, there are some ZK efforts to make things faster / more compact
